data.text: @Gordoncoles6 @LeaveMnsLeave @Nigel_Farage @TiceRichard Great turnout, glad to see Eva Braun back on her feet after a tough few decades as well
@matteallsop Doesn't look very purple to me.
@ClarenceRook @GameOfThrones I reckon I have more of a young James Dean look about me, but I suppose beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
@TuesdayPajamas If they matter at all then why do I pay them so little?
@RichardBlakey1 @mikegalsworthy Actually, apart from gout and some scarring of the liver, my doctor says I'm in rude health.
@corusowls So pleased to hear it, Steve! It used to be the go-to venue for heroin users to shoot up in the toilets, but it really has come a long way in the past two months!
@CafeConcertoNo1 I've heard the "drip dry" technique is useful in a pinch. If it's a number 2 then you're on your own.
@huwrees1 @Djn_71 @stedaniels I may be a dick, Huw, but at least I've cultivated an image as a snappy dresser! And the ladies just love it!
@DerekBlethyn @IainDale And my fee is very reasonable!
@boothcraig3 I'd chalk that up to "rotten luck"! But seriously, if she's already eaten it then don't expect a refund.
@boothcraig3 But the rotten ones are cheaper for me to buy in bulk? I'm not following you here.
@ScoWRob Sorry if my banter was a bit old fashioned for you Scott, I'm more used to talking to adults who don't piss their own pants and ask their mates to take photos.
@ScoWRob Looks like someone isn't quite ready for Big Boy Pants. Keep practising and you'll get there eventually.

@180whit I've spoken to the manager of this outlet, Paul, and he informs me that you'd been drinking alone all afternoon. Maybe call someone who can help - a family member or caregiver? The first step is admitting you have a problem.

@Shazwellyn1 Thanks for the kind words! Next time you're in one of my pubs the first round is on me (up to £20, airports and N.I. not included). Just show the manager this tweet and it's sorted. God bless.
@chefneil66 Apparently the tech team sorted this out months ago, but they require my signature and I've never been sober enough at a meeting to produce one...or so I'm told.
@LaurenceBraith1 @wiganwoody @WeatherspoonsU Oh, that's just our normal clientele. Homeless people are welcome too - just as long as they buy something.
@wiganwoody @LaurenceBraith1 @WeatherspoonsU Don't forget that our toilet sinks offer our customers the chance of a wash, often for the first time in months.

@LaurenceBraith1 @WeatherspoonsU I'm sure they would have preferred I spend the money on letting the public know my thoughts on the metropolitan elite than a pay rise. Some things are more important than money, and they get free squash or water (tap) while on shift.
@bukowskikerouac I'm assuming you had to fish this back out of the toilet, Ed. Have a good think about your actions.
@TatiannaWanyan1 @RCorbettMEP @cunningham_cch @Dyson I only live on a relatively modest income, so no, sorry.
@ianpowe96421384 Pfft, I could do it easily if I wanted to. You just need to tighten your belt, Ian. I'd probably have money left over to have the Jag serviced to boot.

@_hanimustafa @SJonarp I wouldn't want to rouse what is obviously one of the great minds of the age to anger, so I shall leave you be. Do pop in to one of our outlets some time - we do a nice bit of gammon.
@_hanimustafa @SJonarp If you ever met the man then you might be surprised by just how slender the difference is...
@applechunk Interesting idea, Simon. Why not pitch it to me in the letters section of the next edition of Wetherspoon News?
@JeffreySParkes Haha, it's like I tell the wife Jeffrey - the first 10 pints are medicinal and anything after that is recreational!
@BillMur45727101 @WetherspoonNews You leave my drinking problem out of this! It's a medical condition!
@Sam_J_Burgess I've no interest in your ring. Try one of the phone numbers written in one of our toilet cubicles.

@ManagerMummy @DouglasQuigg @DrPhillipLeeMP "Make it like she's holding a telephone! You know, like that 'It's a Deal' programme with Noel Edmonds! Cor, this will get The Man on the Street's blood pumping! They're simply sick of (other) millionaires telling them how to live their lives!"
@ManagerMummy @DouglasQuigg @DrPhillipLeeMP You didn't appreciate the little bobblehead characters I had the work experience boy make on his laptop?

@DeftManc @ICOnews @AngelaRayner If you didn't want unsolicited post then you should have locked your letterbox. I've been known to push various appendages through people's letterboxes after a few shandies, so you got off lightly anyway.
@Welsh_Dragon_71 Not really. I only want the Brexity types in anyway. They spend more on real ale and don't throw up everywhere at the weekends.
@FaddenSean @MartinOgle1 @SylvesterPurr @OwenJones84 I honestly didn't have a clue what the rate of pay is. I assume that whatever it is, it's enough for them to live comfortably on.
@RGGumm @DanBot356 If it's Tim on the tin...
@RGGumm @DanBot356 If they're having to deal with charming little boys like yourself on a regular basis then £32k doesn't seem quite enough.

@Djn_71 @stedaniels Well, they're welcome to move there and live like kings. Besides, I bet most of them have got a little something squirrelled away for a rainy day...most likely lifted from my tills! Cheeky beggars!
@Judykyra @OwenJones84 If @OwenJones84 had caught me before 10am, then sober? Maybe. But dignified? Can't help you there, I'm afraid. I mean just look at me.
@Judykyra @OwenJones84 Just a bit merry after my third bottle of Beaujolais.

@TonyPeck46 You know that something like 90% of all ice tested contained traces of human faeces? You've dodged a bullet there Tony, me old mucker. Unless you're, uh...into that kind of thing. The wife is, actually, but I've never been too keen. Had to put my foot down eventually.
@BlakeNordstrom1 @OwenJones84 You're talking to a man who hasn't changed his pants in three weeks. I think I'd have change left over at the end of the week.

@BlakeNordstrom1 @OwenJones84 I kept my cool well. Owen Jones was on some kind of crusade to demand a wage that staff can live on - how would that benefit my shareholders? Ridiculous. He'll be expecting me to remember the names of the board next.
@FerryBus2017 But if you forget a stamp then it means we'll have to pay for it!
@Sergeant_Bilko @OwenJones84 @guardian My rugby top was in the wash.
@thecheechman @OwenJones84 I don't like the straight banana ones. Or the ones where you can't sing 'Baa baa black sheep' or something. Look, details aren't my strong point. What would Churchill say?
@LesVivian1 For a rough approximation of Ruddles Best, you could have asked the bar staff to dip a teabag into a pint of cold water for five seconds.

@LouiseRawAuthor Well I've had a lot of feedback from real people (not rich Notting Hill types like yourself). Barry, highways agency worker, 57, from Stafford, wrote to me with this: "Good on you Tim - about time this country looked to the future by going back 65 years into the past. Cheers!"

When compared to workers in Bangladesh, our bar staff are paid a small fortune. It probably never occurred to 'Richard' that he's an incredibly wealthy man...to most Bangladeshis. Check your privilege next time.

https://t.co/t0al5TJc0D

@NewStatesman @JonnElledge You might not like me, and I might be guilty of many things, including all of the above (and more: you didn't even touch on my drinking problem), but don't you dare besmirch the memory of the late, great Peter Stringfellow.

@BrianHorrocks1 @smtm_LFC Hi Brian. I actually wrote an editorial about 5 years ago, explaining how we'd had to introduce special cutlery in our Barrow outlet to account for the extra digits the locals were sporting. I had almost no feedback from the town's residents - I assume due to low literacy rates.

@smtm_LFC @BrianHorrocks1 Hey now! No need for swearies. Besides, I've been described as "the very model of the modern man: suave, sophisticated and devilishly handsome" by no less than Wetherspoon News.
@weaniejeanie53 @gregchatterton @trumpy675 I actually have three GCEs, including one in physics, so this is quite embarrassing for you, isn't it?

@alroe501 I cut out the middleman myself, Alan, and drink the gin straight. I've actually hidden a bottle in the cistern - apparently I was developing 's problem' (according to both my doctor and the old ball-and-chain).
@michael_lights @JamesMelville We are actually hiring carpet cleaners at the moment. I'd ask if you were interested, but I feel you'd be...underqualified
@Parkerman75 It's up for a Pulitzer next year, me old fruitbat
@Trevor_Rawlins @nicholasscrivs @bronaghwaugh Well those Aussies aren't backwards about coming forwards, or indeed, upside down about c-c...coming...rightways...r-rightways...round
@Sally300131682 Haha, yes, that certainly does sound like us!
@BiteMeBtn Language, Timothy!
@thebrexits Great seeing you Marc - and no, I now carry around a hip flask of turps for emergencies! 🤣

@itszilzalbytwo @BorisJohnson @Nigel_Farage @michaelgove @andywigmore @Arron_banks @Jacob_Rees_Mogg @piersmorgan @realDonaldTrump You'll never get me, Simon. I'm old enough to not know how to block you.
@timoncheese The small percentage of our customers who can read are generally pretty good about following these rules.
@timrich We have to be considerate of our Muslim customers.
@megaark1 @BMEuropean @RemainerNow Our "Meat Parts Pie" won't be affected, since its contents are just below the legal threshold to be classed as either beef or lamb.

tweets.text: Is that geezer who owns #Wetherspoons @GroovyTimbo a #WhiteWalker ? Did @GameOfThrones base their look on him ?
@GroovyTimbo Timbo I do like your pubs very much but the staff also matter.

@mikegalsworthy Medical Case1: this poor old man @GroovyTimbo has been struck by lightning. See the flash burns to his face & the tell tale ‘Worzel Gummidge’ hair sign. Unfortunately the bolt went straight through his frontal lobes, resulting in disinhibited gibbering rants & confabulation.

@GroovyTimbo  ......We went into Royal Victoria Pavillion Ramsgate last week ..... Fantastic ... That iconic building restored ..... Good food .... Polite & helpful staff ....We loved it & will return

@GroovyTimbo  Enjoyed a drink tonight in goodman's fields London.  BUT  told the barstaff at 10pm that all 8 ladies loos had  no loo roll at all in.  Left 45 mins later & none in still (yes, I checked as I thought it was important for you! - nobody cares, sadly!!
@GroovyTimbo @Djn_71 @stedaniels You really are a dick @groovytimbo
@IainDale @GroovyTimbo is always entertaining and game for a laugh
@GroovyTimbo My child was given a rotten banana in one of your pubs today https://t.co/IihuSJugwd
@GroovyTimbo maybe instead of bombarding the country with your propaganda on Brexit, you should focus on not serving children rotten bananas in your pubs
@GroovyTimbo only had 1 pint in wolverhampton JDs...i wonder why.! Seems its every spoons i visit..wont be using again in a hurry... https://t.co/Lyj7RdprHJ

@GroovyTimbo hi Tim.  I'm a camra member and met you in the nightjar ferndown and   I have a question  for you . Would you be able to put some of the  guestl ales on the app as it's only Abbott on at the moment.  
Would like an answer and your thoughts on the idea .
@GroovyTimbo @wiganwoody @WeatherspoonsU If you give homeless people the opportunity to freshen up and take a break from the outside then I applaud you.

@LaurenceBraith1 @WeatherspoonsU @GroovyTimbo Like Tim or not, in Wetherspoons you can sit there all day in the warmth, get free wifi and coffee for less than £1.50 and refill it all day.
Tim has done a great deal for the British high street, and without what he does we would be a great deal worse off.

Just had the rancid @WeatherspoonsU 'WEATHERSPOONSNEWS' put through my letterbox. @GroovyTimbo, this 48 page rag + distribution must have cost a pretty packet. Why didn't you spend the money paying your staff a #livingwage? https://t.co/4N1k6wLsuN

#Weatherspoons @GroovyTimbo 
What an arrogant man Tim Martin is, to think everyone needs to know his political ideology. The reason he doesn’t like the EU is because they protect workers rights, while he likes to pay his staff much less than the living wage. https://t.co/O6j23ACxZW
Can't live on £8 an hour https://t.co/L7U1ZD3UAp

@GroovyTimbo Hey Tim. Your Wetherspoons Magazine...  Don’t suppose you can make it out of material that’s flushable and more absorbent. Seems a shame to throw something in the garbage without doing something useful with it first. 💩
Well said Sir Tim! Purely medicinal! :) https://t.co/8I2944TAcF

Just received a political rant under the vague pretence of being the @WetherspoonNews. I think @GroovyTimbo should stick to selling his product instead of sampling it. Which he clearly has been doing at length if he thought this was a good idea.
@GroovyTimbo y’all owe me an onion ring https://t.co/aSFqQUx9ec
@ManagerMummy @DouglasQuigg @DrPhillipLeeMP You didn't appreciate the little bobblehead characters I had the work experience boy make on his laptop?

What an odious rag to come home to, pushed through my door. Full of crap 💩 @GroovyTimbo NEVER put this shit through my door again. @DouglasQuigg there should be laws against political opinion door drops from non political twats!😡@DrPhillipLeeMP https://t.co/XI0Bynyveg
@MartinOgle1 @SylvesterPurr @OwenJones84 @GroovyTimbo  didn't challenge @OwenJones84  at any point about the accuracy of the hourly pay rate...
@stedaniels @GroovyTimbo It’s called relative poverty and we’re not in Bangladesh
@GroovyTimbo @OwenJones84 Perhaps then you could give a sober and dignified response to the minimum wage question?
@OwenJones84 Are you sure Tim Martin wasnt drunk? @GroovyTimbo

@GroovyTimbo @OwenJones84 Tim What happened to the JDW’s off old, Sunday Roast Dinners with family and friends, wonderful times. You’ve turned JDW pubs into Brexit knocking-shops, not all your customers are Brexiteers. Which is why we no longer frequent JDW’s. Genuine question could you live on £8:05?
Oi @GroovyTimbo not so groovy now are you Tim after an interview with @OwenJones84 ... you couldn't even name a single EU law you disliked!! Lollllllllllllllll https://t.co/fbx3t0obcy

How kind of Tim Martin @GroovyTimbo to supply free loo paper. If, like me, you've had plenty of his shit, rather than sticking it in recycling, might I suggest mailing to:

Wetherspoon House
Central Park
Reeds Crescent
Watford
WD34 4QL

If you 'forget' a stamp, all the better. https://t.co/uIWtn7gUGR

@GroovyTimbo just watched your interview by @OwenJones84 and you come across as even more ignorant on the EU then i ever thought. Please name the EU law that you don't like? #BrexitShambles #Brexitchaos #brexitlies #boycottweatherspoons

⁦@GroovyTimbo⁩  These are the ales not available in The Brightwater, in Southampton, the worst Wetherspoons I have been to! Funnily enough it was good last week when you were in Southampton ! https://t.co/t4fl9XWF9a

The twin Bannon-Martin entity’s (shared) hand can be detected  in the latest Wetherspoons News,one of the weirdest things I’ve seen in print (& I include my own work)- pages of pro-Brexit rants & attacks on the ‘Metropolitan Elite’, with occasional breaks to discuss bar snacks https://t.co/1Mef01jL21

It turns out Wetherspoons News has been borrowing other people's content.

Well, republish this, Tim Martin, and then provide a comment – you weird, creepy looking, self-important, Peter Stringfellow-a-like, Hard Brexit Twat, says @JonnElledge

https://t.co/v4Qg1ckwsr
@gregchatterton @trumpy675 Don’t forget to pop a couple of bricks in - as @GroovyTimbo is as thick as one he’ll probably appreciate them.

@JamesMelville Wetherspoons are awful pubs where chavs get drunk on Friday & Saturday & then return for a fry up the next morning. Drunken hellholes full of dickheads & carpets that permanently stink of beer. Who needs wine when there’s Carling anyway. @GroovyTimbo piss off & clean the carpets

Reading this now. Hard to pick my favourite piece of crassness, but at the moment it’s when Tim Martin @GroovyTimbo (really) praises the Australian High Commissioner with “These descendants of convicts usually talk sense”. @nicholasscrivs @bronaghwaugh https://t.co/72vSyFbMdc
@GroovyTimbo Hope it fits! #boycottwetherspoons #fuckyoutim #shoveit https://t.co/IQ8jp1IElY

@GroovyTimbo Hi Groovy T, Great LML Rally again, was good to meet U & shake Your hand, I went to my local Wetherspoons in Palmers Green for a couple after the Rally, did U self administer rubbing Alcohol in a shop doorway again?😂 Seeya at the next one👍
The Wetherspoons dress code is very strict. https://t.co/JxQfXJV7PX

@BMEuropean @RemainerNow But I thought everything would be fine on WTO rules? @GroovyTimbo said so. Oh hang on.... 

#Brexitlies #StopBrexit #eu #3Blokesinapub #PeoplesVote
